The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: I didn’t enjoy the game at all. It completely burned the original\, but i find it beautiful in a way. It was heart aching and shoved the idea that revenge is bad. But the reason why I give it a ten is how effective the game is to display the tragedy of Ellie. The game takes a character you love so much and destroy it\, illustrating the flaws everyone has. I know many people may argue against me but if found this meaning in the game. This game is not like the first one\, rather it pushes the boundaries of games becoming art. The developers don’t want you to have fun. Therefore\, they strip every character that Ellie cares about and allow their deaths to be so pointless that her fight for revenge becomes pointless in itself. Joel died in such a stupid way because it is a parallel to Ellie’s need to die in a meaningful way as it would allow her life to have meaning. Hence when Joel stripped her ability to save humanity in the first game\, Ellie lost her relationship with Joel because of that. Hence when Joel dies such a stupid and pointless death\, Ellie fights for revenge for some catharsis. Her nightmares forcing her to kill Abby and then in the final climax she realising killing Abby won’t do anything\, but rather her inability to forgive Joel for saving her and always trying to help her is why she is always tormented by Joel’s death. Thus realising that life doesn’t have to have any meaning and people die meaningless or pointless deaths. It’s an acceptance of living a life with satisfaction and around the people who care about you. It’s a growth in maturity for Ellie. It’s a brilliant tragedy of an acceptance of a harsh reality. The entire fight to Seattle and then Santa Barbara is so tiring and pointless to play because there is no meaning at all to have such a fight. That’s exactly what the developers want you to feel\, that annoyance. It isn’t an enjoyable game like the first one\, but that’s what drives the narrative and expressive intent by the creators.
